Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx or lion (underbelly and thigh remaining) to right; part of swastika as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leipzig, Institut für Klassische Archäologie und Antikenmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd was lost in WWII.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0211) (phase 2)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 253, no. 414, pl. 56, no. 414)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: 1912.32a (Ashmolean Exchange (not a unique number))
